DOC.brief_summary: This study aim understand long-term health , social , economic impact transition community Highly Effective Reversible Contraception ( HER-C ) .
DOC.detailed_description: The persistently high rate unintended pregnancy US suggest inadequacy current prevention model need new approach contraceptive acceptability promotion . Although popularity Highly Effective Reversible Contraception ( HER-C ) US steadily increase , less 10 % contracepting woman use intrauterine device ( IUDs ) subdermal contraceptive implant , effective method avoid unintended pregnancy . Poverty important predictor unintended pregnancy woman incomes Federal Poverty Level ( FPL ) five-fold increase risk unintended pregnancy relative woman higher incomes . Because limited public fund family planning , low-income woman Salt Lake County limit access HER-C , high initiation cost significant cost-saving potential time . Additionally , contraceptive research inadequately measure social impact HER-C . The first aim HER Salt Lake Initiative evaluate increase HER-C method three strategy : 1 ) Client center contraceptive counseling ; 2 ) Removal financial barrier ; 3 ) Targeted medium campaign . The second aim HER Salt Lake Initiative ass change earnings education among woman initiate HER-C compare method contraception model project lifetime earn potential woman base contraceptive method choice .
